title: Bug 32286: ControlExample Button Tab - Changing styles resets button orientation
description:
Ensure that Eclipse is not running. Accept new configuration defaults.

Reproduction Steps:
1. Install the M5 example plugins.
2. Start Eclipse.
3. Go to Window -> Show View -> Other and select SWT Controls under SWT Examples. Expand the new view if necessary, and click on the button tab.
4. The buttons will change to arrow buttons, pointing up.
5. On the right of the pane, select 'SWT.ARROW' in the styles group.
6. Select an alignment other than 'up' from the alignment group.
7. Select a new orientation for the arrows.
8. Then select or deselect 'SWT.BORDER' in the styles group.

Observed Behavior: When using the Button controls from the SWT Controls example, if SWT.ARROW buttons are used and the SWT.BORDER property is selected or deselected, the arrow alignment property of all the arrow buttons is reset to 'UP'.

Expected Behavior: The arrow orientation should not change when selecting or deselecting the SWT.BORDER property.

Environment:
- OS: HPUX 11.11
- Eclipse: V2.1 Build Id: 200302061700 (M5), with M5 example plugins.
OB: The arrow alignment property of all the arrow buttons is reset to UP when the SWT.BORDER property is selected or deselected.
EB: Select or deselect the SWT.BORDER property in the styles group.
